TopicTitle: [1.0.2] LiquidTanks: LF-only tanks for nuclear engines

Articles.Content:
1.0 brought lots of new changes, and one of them was that now, nuclear engines only require liquid fueled engines to run. This would be a goo thing, but currently the only LF-only tanks are aircraft parts, which do not make very good interplanetary motherships. This mod adds a new version of each stock fuel tank that contains only liquid fuel, so you can go on building interplanetary craft as you did before 1.0!

Requires ModuleManager, but patch is included in download

![ehjgcl.png](http://i59.tinypic.com/ehjgcl.png)

[**DOWNLOAD FROM KERBALSTUFF**](https://kerbalstuff.com/mod/792/LiquidTanks:%20Liquid-only%20tanks%20for%20nuclear%20engines!)

**Edited <time datetime="2015-05-14T12:20:23Z" title="05/14/2015 12:20  PM" data-short="9 yr">May 14, 2015</time> by FishInferno**
You beat me by like, a day.
Is this done through tweakables or with a a load of extra parts in the parts menu? Would love to be able to do this with just tweakables to keep things neat.
Is there a game mechanic I miss or is it the same as just leaving the oxidizer at home?

It should be possible to use MM in combination with either FSFuelSwitch or InterstellarFuelSwitch to patch all fuel tanks to be able to switch between LFO, LF and O, including more "LF" and more "O" if the tank is only used for that.

If nobody else does it, I will do it once I actually unlock a nuclear engine ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> Is this done through tweakables or with a a load of extra parts in the parts menu? Would love to be able to do this with just tweakables to keep things neat.

This adds new parts. IN the stock game, you can tweak out the oxidizer, but you cannot add extra LF, so you have a half-full tank and wasted mass
Huh, why did someone rate this one star?

> 
> Huh, why did someone rate this one star?

Where do you rate stuff? You deserve rep just for doing this. I personally use FSfuelswitch, but stuff like this \*should\* have been in the stock game since they made the choice to switch the nuke to LF only ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

> I'd be very interested in that. As much as the stock problem is annoying, I really don't want to double the number of fuel tank parts.

Yes, that is the problem I guess. Luckily it reuses the stock texture so there is minimal RAM usage

Woops, sorry I tried to ninja-delete my post. Turns out Porkjet has already done it. Not fast enough! It's not so much the RAM usage as it is parts list clutter that I was afraid of. For some people though I think yours is definitely a better solution!
